newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes unchanged vs US dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes unchanged vs US dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed unchanged at 8.3010 on Monday from last Friday's close against the U.S. dollar on the Shanghai-based interbank foreign exchange market, traders said.
The yuan opened flat at 8.3010 and consolidated around that level for most of the session, hitting an intra-day low of 8.3017 and a high of 8.3000.
Trading was dull, with most done at 8.3010, traders said.
Dealers said the yuan was sandwiched between strong selling at a topside of 8.3000 and active bids at about 8.3020.
"Most traders believe 8.30 is a key resistance level, which seems hard for the yuan to breach in the short term," one dealer said.
"The yuan is likely to move steadily after a long consolidation below 8.3000," said a second dealer,
Dealers expect the yuan to move around 8.3010 on Tuesday.
The yuan closed up at an intra-day high of 7.3005 from 7.3450 against 100 Japanese yen and higher at 1.0733 from 1.0740 against the Hong Kong dollar.
